entry.title: “A Big Thank You to M’sians!” Access Up to 17 Channels, Box Upgrades & More Await All Astro Customers

category.term: Chief Sales & Marketing Officer of Astro

entry.summary:
Whether when we’re hooked on a gripping TV series or blockbuster film, or just want something fun and educational for our children to watch, there’s no denying that entertainment is a vital part of our lives, kan? So to express their gratitude for entrusting them as Malaysia’s leading entertainment provider, here’s what Astro has in […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
Whether when we’re hooked on a gripping TV series or blockbuster film, or just want something fun and educational for our children to watch, there’s no denying that entertainment is a vital part of our lives, kan? So to express their gratitude for entrusting them as Malaysia’s leading entertainment provider, here’s what Astro has in store for customers!

Astro wants to give a Big Thank You to customers with up to 17 additional channels, free box upgrades and complimentary Astro First viewing!

In a heartfelt gesture of appreciation for all customers, Astro is going beyond to deliver exceptional entertainment with up to 17 additional channels, free Ultra and Ulti Box upgrades, and complimentary Astro First movie redemptions. With so much on the table, there’s sure to be something special for each Astro customer’s household!

 

You’ll be thanking Astro back for their offerings!

As part of their initiative to go all out with their Big Thank You, here’s what Astro is offering:

  1. Up to 17 additional channels spanning movies, drama, news, and kids’ entertainment
  2. Free Ultra and Ulti Box upgrades for smoother on-demand streaming
  3. Complimentary Astro First movie redemptions to help you catch the most highly anticipated cinema blockbusters on your TV screen!

And the best part is you can get these amazing extras without any extra cost!

These rewards are available for My Astro app members, so to check your eligibility for Astro’s Big Thank You offers, just download and login to the My Astro app. But you better act fast! The upgrades are available for a limited time only, so hurry and find out what are your rewards today!

Tai Kam Leong, Chief Sales & Marketing Officer of Astro, said, “At Astro, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. Through Astro’s Big Thank You, our biggest giveaway ever, we are thrilled to express our gratitude with exciting, personalised rewards that enhance their entertainment experience. We appreciate all our customers and invite you to discover all we’ve prepared, especially for you. This is our way of thanking you for our unwavering support and loyalty in choosing us as your trusted Home of Entertainment.”

 

Kids and the entire fam can get in on the Big Thank You too!

To commemorate the year-end holidays, all customers will enjoy a complimentary pop-up channel, Home of Kids (CH100), available from 1 to 31 December 2024. Consisting of family-friendly favourites including Astro Ceria, Nickelodeon, Nick Jr., Moonbug and DreamWorks, this pop-up channel promises endless fun and entertainment for young viewers. This will be a great way for your kids to spend their free time this school holiday!

This channel also coincides with the exciting “Home of Kids” event, which will take place this 26 to 29 December 2024 at the IOI Convention Centre in Putrajaya during the school holidays. We heard the Home of Kids event will be packed with fun activities for the family including meet-and-greets with popular cartoon characters, musical performances and more! Parents, make sure to mark your calendars this 26 to 29 December for an exciting time with your little ones!

With this superb giveaway, Astro is showing how super thankful they are for their customers’ support throughout the years and will be steadfast in delivering a premium, accessible entertainment experience for Malaysians everywhere!

 

That’s not all; get Jualan Jimat Besar to save more on your subscription!

As another little ‘thank you’ on the side, Astro also raises you a new limited-time offer – JUALAN JIMAT BESAR with the lowest price ever from RM41.99/month* and free installation! Plus, you can go even further with your streaming experience by adding Astro Fibre’s 500Mbps together with the Primary Pack for just RM149.99/month* (RRP: RM239.99) for 24 months. This offer is only available until 8 December 2024 so sign up now before it ends!

 

Enjoy the best of entertainment, all in one place with Astro! For more information, log in to the My Astro app, visit their website or WhatsApp 03-9543 3838. Follow them on their socials for the latest updates:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • TikTok

*All prices quoted in this release are excluding tax. Terms and conditions apply for each campaign/offer.

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: Heartbreaking Video Shows People Performing CPR on Deceased Workers After Crane Collapsed in Putrajaya
entry.summary:
2 Indonesian workers died while another was severely injured after they had fallen from a collapsing crane while painting a building in Precinct 8, Putrajaya. According to a report by Berita Harian, the incident took place at 9:20am, when the 3 men were painting the walls of the 7th floor of a condo while standing […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
2 Indonesian workers died while another was severely injured after they had fallen from a collapsing crane while painting a building in Precinct 8, Putrajaya.

According to a report by Berita Harian, the incident took place at 9:20am, when the 3 men were painting the walls of the 7th floor of a condo while standing in the basket of the crane. The crane was said to overturn and fall to the ground, causing all 3 men to fall along with it.

Putrajaya District Police Chief, Assistant Commissioner Aidi Sham Mohamed, shared that the deceased victims were identified as 54-year-old Sukawan Wilkhan and 53-year-old Danianto Yusak, while the injured victim was identified as 56-year-old Yasin.

“Initial investigations found that the accident was caused when the hydraulic jack of the machinery sank into the ground, causing the crane to lose balance and overturn. At the time of the incident, the 3 victims were in the basket of the crane to paint the building,” he said.

 

People tried to save them

Videos following the incident were shared on social media, where people could be seen performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) on the fallen workers, while white paint covered the workers and the ground.

You can check out the heartbreaking footage here (viewer discretion is advised).

What do you think about this? Do feel free to share your thoughts in the comment section.

 

Also read: 17yo Straight-A Student Slips Into a Coma a Day Before Her SPM Exam After Complaining of Headaches

Source: #UpdateInfo
Source: #UpdateInfo
Source: #UpdateInfo
Source: #UpdateInfo

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: Pahang State Govt: You Can Be Fined or Sent to Prison for Dressing Inappropriately
entry.summary:
The Pahang State Government has enacted a Syariah ordinance concerning the offence of dressing inappropriately in public places. According to the Pahang State Executive Councilor for Islamic Affairs, Rural Development, and Orang Asli Affairs, YB. Dato’ Sri Syed Ibrahim Syed Ahmad, the Syariah ordinance is not something new. It was enacted back in 2013. “The […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
The Pahang State Government has enacted a Syariah ordinance concerning the offence of dressing inappropriately in public places.

According to the Pahang State Executive Councilor for Islamic Affairs, Rural Development, and Orang Asli Affairs, YB. Dato’ Sri Syed Ibrahim Syed Ahmad, the Syariah ordinance is not something new. It was enacted back in 2013.

“The Pahang State Government has established a Syariah ordinance in 2013 under Section 53 for those who dress inappropriately in public places,” Syed Ibrahim said during the 3rd Meeting of the 3rd Term of the Pahang State Legislative Assembly at Wisma Sri Pahang recently.

He made this statement while responding to a question from another Member of the State Legislative Assembly (ADUN) for Jengka, YB. Tuan Shahril Azman Abd Halim, regarding the government’s policy on entertainment involving performances by Muslim women who do not cover their aurat.

 

You can be fined or imprisoned

The Pahang 2013 Syariah Criminal Offenses Enactment, Section 53: Dressing Inappropriately in Public states that anyone who dresses inappropriately in public can be fined up to RM2,000 or face imprisonment of not more than a year, or both.

For instance, The Temerloh Widows’ Costume Competition scheduled for April 21 this year at a karaoke centre near Taman Tasik Chatin, near Mentakab, Pahang has been cancelled. Temerloh Member of Parliament, Salamiah Mohd Nor wanted the event cancelled as it could cause public unease and spread immoral elements, as said by Salamiah in her Facebook post.

You can go through the Syariah Enactment here, which is stated on page 9.

What do you think of this enactment?

 

Also read: “She never shows off” – Humble Local Actress Shares Her RM19 Dress That She Bought from Shopee

Source: YouTube | Pahang Media TV
Source: Facebook | Salamiah Mohd Nor

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: “Dirty & disgusting” – M’sian Actor Slams Cinemagoers Who Use Front Seats as Foot Rests for Their Bare Feet
entry.summary:
A small group of Malaysian cinemagoers recently received backlash online for not following cinema etiquette before the movie started. Malaysian actor, Mierul Aiman took to his X account @mierulaimanx and shared a screenshot of an Instagram story where the user voiced out against moviegoers who casually placed their bare feet on top of the unoccupied […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
A small group of Malaysian cinemagoers recently received backlash online for not following cinema etiquette before the movie started.

Malaysian actor, Mierul Aiman took to his X account @mierulaimanx and shared a screenshot of an Instagram story where the user voiced out against moviegoers who casually placed their bare feet on top of the unoccupied seats in front during the Kahar: Kapla High Council movie.

Mierul, who also stars in the movie sought answers from netizens.

“I’m sorry for asking but is this common? This is my first time seeing this.”

In the reposted screenshot, Mierul also dubbed the inconsiderate action “dirty and disgusting,” and reminded everyone to show respect and consideration in shared spaces.

“We can look stupid but don’t be stupid. It’s not that hard to show some respect. Don’t assume everywhere is home.”

Social media users also expressed disgust at the behaviours of the said cinemagoers and said it was inconsiderate.

“This is rude and inconsiderate.”

“If we tell them off, it’s going to get heated. People like this are usually stupid and egotistical.”

“With CCTV cameras in the hall, they should’ve been fined RM100 each.”

Another user said this is something that should not be normalized, saying, “It pisses me off to see people behaving like this.”

“If you see others behaving the same way, feel free to inform the cinema ushers. They have the right to remove anyone who disrespects others in the cinema.”

“We should make it common to tell off anyone who behaves like this.”

To those who frequent the cinemas, what would you do if you spotted such behaviour? Would you tell them off if they happen to rest their feet on top, or next to your seat?

 

Also read: “They don’t make films like this anymore” – M’sian Has Watched Top Gun: Maverick In Theatres 59 Times!

Source: X | mierulaimanx

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: 17yo Straight-A Student Slips Into a Coma a Day Before Her SPM Exam After Complaining of Headaches
entry.summary:
A student with an excellent academic track record fell into a coma after complaining of a headache the day before she was due to take her SPM examinations. Unfortunately, the bright girl didn’t make it. According to a report by China Press, the girl was rushed to a hospital where she spent 2 days in […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
A student with an excellent academic track record fell into a coma after complaining of a headache the day before she was due to take her SPM examinations. Unfortunately, the bright girl didn’t make it.

According to a report by China Press, the girl was rushed to a hospital where she spent 2 days in a comatose state before passing away this morning (December 5). The student, a 17-year-old girl from Batu Pahat, Johor, is said to be her family’s only daughter and a straight-A student.

This image is for illustration purposes only.

Johor State Health and Environment Committee Chairman and State Assemblyman, Ling Tian Soon, confirmed the incident.

 

She complained of a headache and fainted

He shared that the girl had complained to her family about a headache while at home 2 days ago. She soon fainted and was sent to a clinic for first aid. She was then rushed to a hospital for further treatment.

“The doctor said that the female student suffered from blood stasis due to a burst blood vessel in her brain, causing her to go into a coma. The female student was in a coma when she was admitted to the hospital. Her teachers and classmates went to visit her in the past 2 days,”

“But unexpectedly, the situation took a turn for the worst. She could not withstand the call of death and sadly passed away at about 9:40am, this morning,” he said.

Ling went on to share how the student’s parents had praised her for being diligent and hard-working and had been focused on preparing for her SPM examinations to obtain good results.

Her parents took good care of her and accompanied her while she was in a comatose state in the hospital.

Our sincerest condolences to the student’s family, friends and loved ones.

 

What do you think about this? Do feel free to share your thoughts in the comment section.

 

Also read: “Mummy, it hurts so much” – Container Crash Victim’s Mum Shares How She Found Her Daughter

Source: Detik Health
Source: China Press

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: DragonForce M’sia Claims Data Leak of 17 Million ICs is Fake, Shares Uncensored Images of Sample ICs
entry.summary:
Just yesterday, it was reported that a Singapore-based dark web intelligence agency, StealthMole, had claimed that the data of 17 million identity cards (ICs) belonging to Malaysians were being sold online. Today, another group is saying otherwise. Malaysian hacker group, DragonForce Malaysia, took to their X page to claim that StealthMole’s accusations are untrue, as […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
Just yesterday, it was reported that a Singapore-based dark web intelligence agency, StealthMole, had claimed that the data of 17 million identity cards (ICs) belonging to Malaysians were being sold online.

Today, another group is saying otherwise.

Malaysian hacker group, DragonForce Malaysia, took to their X page to claim that StealthMole’s accusations are untrue, as the ICs showcased apparently have false and weird names such as ‘Devil Bin Satan’.

This image is for illustration purposes only.

They wrote, “You’re not sure? Don’t share it!”

“We’re angry with media practitioners and influencers for playing tricks with invalid information. Does ‘Sultan Sulu’ have an IC? If it’s easy to get attention like this, we can post 2 to 3 photos of zionists’ passports and claim that 50 million zionists’ passports have been leaked.”

 

In Stealth Mole’s post, they shared how the people responsible for selling Malaysians’ IC data had posted a photo showing several sample ICs that have been censored.

DragonForce Malaysia shared the same picture uncensored, with the IC holder’s names shown as ‘Devil Bin Satan’, ‘Dato Hussin’ and more, to prove that the ICs are supposedly fake.

It is also important to note that Devil Bin Satan’s IC states that his birthday is October 2, 2000, making him 24 years old. However, his IC picture clearly shows an elderly man well beyond his 20s.

 

Nonetheless, we hope authorities will investigate this matter and offer more clarity on the issue.

What do you think about this? Do feel free to share your thoughts in the comment section.

 

Also read: Congresswoman Says US Govt is Wasting Taxpayer Funds By Funding Things Like “Sex Apps in Malaysia”

Source: SoftDynasty
Source: Fusion Intelligence Center @ StealthMole
Source: DragonForce Malaysia

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: M’sian Bakery Surprises Auntie with a Mini Celebration After She Bought Her Own Birthday Cake to Celebrate Alone
entry.summary:
No one’s special day should be celebrated alone. In a recent heartwarming video that’s been making the rounds online, an auntie is seen visiting a bakery in Kuala Lumpur to purchase a cake. The auntie bought the cake for her own birthday @sundaydo.hq posted a TikTok video about a heartwarming incident where an auntie walked […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
No one’s special day should be celebrated alone.

In a recent heartwarming video that’s been making the rounds online, an auntie is seen visiting a bakery in Kuala Lumpur to purchase a cake.

The auntie bought the cake for her own birthday

@sundaydo.hq posted a TikTok video about a heartwarming incident where an auntie walked into their bakery to purchase a birthday cake.

While she was being served, the staff politely asked her who the cake was for, to which the auntie replied that it was, in fact, her own birthday that very day.

“One day, an auntie came in to buy a cake. As usual, our staff asked who the cake was for. The auntie told us it was her birthday.”

The auntie blew out the candle on her cake by herself

When the staff found out it was the auntie’s birthday, she decided to let the auntie know that the cake would be on the house and she wouldn’t be charged.

Despite the kind gesture, the auntie insisted on paying for the cake, but the staff graciously refused to accept the payment.

“A few minutes later, we noticed the auntie celebrating her birthday alone, even blowing out the candle on her cake.”

The auntie left the bakery to visit a nearby shop, but as soon as she stepped out, the staff at the bakery came up with a plan to surprise her with a mini celebration.

“She reminded us why we do what we do”

When the auntie returned to the bakery, she had bought biscuits to give to the staff as a thank-you for their kindness in not charging her for the cake.

However, what she didn’t expect was the surprise waiting for her. As she walked back in, the staff gathered together and started singing “Happy Birthday” to her.

“While we were singing to the auntie, we couldn’t help but get teary-eyed. Some of the staff even started to cry. The auntie’s tears of joy reminded us all of why we do what we do.”

You can watch the full video below:

@sundaydo.hq

Business has its ups and downs, and there have been countless moments when I felt like giving up. But moments like this- witnessing her tears of joy as we sang for her, remind us why we do what we do. This is the reason we keep going. It’s what drives us, and it always will.

♬ Kembali Pulang – Suara Kayu & Feby Putri

We’re not crying, you’re crying…

 

Also read: M’sian BF Wins Netizens’ Hearts by Walking in GF’s Heels After Her Feet Started to Ache During Trip to Zoo

Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq
Source: TikTok | sundaydo.hq

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: “I married my 3rd angel” – M’sian Man Shares How His Current 1st & 2nd Wives Helped Him Plan His 3rd Wedding
entry.summary:
A Malaysian man recently shared a significant highlight of his life that took place on December 1 – he married a third wife, with the support and help of his first and second wives. “On December 1, 2024, I married my 3rd angel from paradise” In his viral Facebook post, Amirul thanked his sporting parents […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
A Malaysian man recently shared a significant highlight of his life that took place on December 1 – he married a third wife, with the support and help of his first and second wives.

“On December 1, 2024, I married my 3rd angel from paradise”

In his viral Facebook post, Amirul thanked his sporting parents for showing up to support his polygamy life, and he also thanked his first two wives for making this happen, and for making the wedding event successful by carrying out their “duties”.

“One was a wedding planner, and another one packed the goody bags. They handled the wedding outfits and the decorations too.”

All of his wives’ families as well as the team members from the Malaysian Harmony Polygamy Organisation also attended the wedding. Amirul also said he initially hesitated to have a wedding ceremony due to the availability of the wedding halls, but he continued with the ceremony, nonetheless.

 

“Polygamy isn’t something new but people still have trouble accepting this”

Amirul also shared his take on polygamy, saying that society is still not accepting of polygamy.

“No doubt, there have been cases of domestic violence but we have to admit, the society is still having a hard time to understand polygamy.”

The man also said he started his polygamy life in 2021, making this his 4th year practising polygamy. Throughout the years, he has met people in the same circle who practice similar polygamy marriages and suggested Malaysian men who want to do the same to mingle in the same circle.

Amirul’s second wedding in 2021

“Monogamy or polygamy, both will not be free from tests,” Amirul added.

In another Facebook post, Amirul shared an invitation that he got for an upcoming talk, where he is expected to share his experience during the talk titled “Polygamy: Love, Career, and Finance.”

The talk is scheduled for this Saturday night (December 6) at 8:30 PM, and social media users can watch via Facebook Live.

Ladies and gentlemen, what do you think of a polygamous relationship?

 

Also read: “I’ll help until he’s stable” – M’sian Woman Says She Doesn’t Mind Marrying a Man with RM2K Salary

Source: Facebook
Source: Facebook

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: 1-2-Jus for State Glory & Win a Share of Vouchers Worth RM120,000 on Lazada 12.12 Showdown! Here’s How
entry.summary:
Who would’ve thought that we would one day become wakil negeri in one of the most classic Malaysian childhood games ever – ‘1-2-Jus’! Some more can win 12.12 shopping vouchers while we’re at it. This year, Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale comes with an interesting twist: Malaysians are invited to battle in a nationwide classic […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
Who would’ve thought that we would one day become wakil negeri in one of the most classic Malaysian childhood games ever – ‘1-2-Jus’! Some more can win 12.12 shopping vouchers while we’re at it.

This year, Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale comes with an interesting twist: Malaysians are invited to battle in a nationwide classic game of ‘1-2-Jus’ (rock-paper-scissors) to claim state pride and awesome rewards for 12.12.

From 4 – 9 December, represent your state in a nationwide competition of ‘1-2-Jus’ at Lazada’s 12.12 Showdown, for your chance to win a share of the RM120,000 vouchers pool.

Play ‘1-2-Jus’ to enjoy more savings during Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale? Just like that eh! Here’s how it works:

 

1. Play ‘1-2-Jus’ to win your share of RM120k vouchers

 

View this post on Instagram

 

A post shared by im_kan_kan (@im_kan_kan)

Any Malaysian would know how to play ‘1-2-Jus’ lah, right? But here’s the twist: in Lazada’s 12.12 Showdown, you’ll be representing your home state alongside fellow statesmen and stateswomen to play a series of ‘1-2-Jus’ matches against the Queen, who has switched to the better 12.12 sale with Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale. However, she holds the treasured prize pool of RM120,000 Lazada 12.12 vouchers, so it’s up to you to defeat her and claim what’s rightfully yours!

Every move you make against the Queen rewards 10 points to your registered state; if your move beats the Queen’s, your state gains another 20 points!* When the game is over, the state with the highest total points will claim bragging rights as the ultimate ‘1-2-Jus’ state and win the grand prize pool of RM120,000 in Lazada 12.12 shopping vouchers, which will be split among participants who contributed to the winning state.


For illustration purposes only.

How to join this ‘1-2-Jus’ tournament? Here are the steps:

  • Step 1: Google “Lazada 12.12 Showdown” and click on the hidden Lazada site.
  • Step 2: Register your name, email, and birth state.
  • Step 3: Choose a move (Rock, Paper, or Scissors) to compete against the Queen’s move and reward 10 points to your registered state.*
  • Step 4: Tune in to Lazada Malaysia’s Instagram account, digital billboards across selected cities, or the hidden Lazada site at 8PM daily to see the Queen’s move of the day and latest rankings; if you beat the Queen, your state gains an extra 20 points!*

*Each registered email address is limited to one submission per day. The daily challenge resets at 8PM.

Wanna boost your state’s chances of winning big? Invite your friends to join the showdown and increase your likelihood of securing the grand prize! You can also keep track of everyone’s progression on the leaderboard, which will be updated daily at 8PM on the hidden Lazada site.


For illustration purposes only.

Aaaaand if you’re lucky enough to receive a direct mailer scratch card in your home mailbox, you can use it to contribute even more points for making a move. Simply enter its unique serial code number on the hidden Lazada site and add 50 points to your move submission; you’ll even contribute 20 extra points for beating the Queen.

With Lazada’s 12.12 Showdown running from 4 – 9 December, the winning state will be announced on Lazada Malaysia’s Instagram page on 10 December 2024.

 

2. The early birds get a Lazada 12.12 voucher

On top of the grand prize, you can also bag daily vouchers throughout Lazada’s 12.12 Showdown! Be the first 100 participants daily to submit your move and receive exclusive Lazada 12.12 vouchers; if you have the scratch card, you will receive Lazada 12.12 vouchers if you’re the first 50 to submit your move.

Even if you didn’t get to be the first 100, you’ll still be rewarded with a participation voucher. Simply keep an eye on your e-mail inbox between 5 and 10 December for the voucher.

But remember ah, be sure to use these vouchers for Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale from 11 December (8PM) to 14 December (11.59PM), otherwise they won’t work!

 

3. Lazada’s 12.12 Showdown: Where we win TOGETHER!

SO easy kan? We get to relieve our nostalgic memories AND stand to win money-saving vouchers – so Malaysian lah. Simply Google “Lazada 12.12 Showdown”, key in your details, play ‘1-2-Jus’, and win your share of the RM120,000 voucher prize pool. Don’t forget to invite your friends to join the showdown and raise your state’s chances of hitting the jackpot.

Also, don’t miss Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale, which will feature discounts of up to 90% off, campaign vouchers worth up to RM800, and free shipping for all. Early bird sale will run from 8 December (8PM) to 11 December (7.59PM), with Lazada’s 12.12 All Out Sale running from 11 December (8PM) to 14 December.

Faster search “Lazada 12.12 Showdown” from now till 9 December (8PM) and ‘1-2-Jus’ for your state glory!

For more info on Lazada 12.12 Showdown, check out Lazada’s socials below:

  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • TikTok

Terms & conditions apply.

 

Source: Provided to WOB
Source: WOB

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: Influencers Turn Car into “Swimming Pool” & Attempt to Travel from Klang to T’ganu in it, Get Stopped by PDRM
entry.summary:
Recently, a local influencer was stopped by the police for riding with his friends in a Proton Waja that had been converted into a swimming pool, while it was being towed by a BMW on the highway. The influencer, Isa Isarb, took to his TikTok page to showcase the incident, in which the police officer […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
Recently, a local influencer was stopped by the police for riding with his friends in a Proton Waja that had been converted into a swimming pool, while it was being towed by a BMW on the highway.

The influencer, Isa Isarb, took to his TikTok page to showcase the incident, in which the police officer who stopped him and his friends told them to stop their antics.

He wrote, “Isa Isarb got stopped by the police!”

 

In the video showcased, Isa Isarb and his friends could be seen in the swimming pool of the converted Proton Waja, while it was being towed by a BMW on a highway.

The Proton Waja’s roof had been cut off and the entire backseat had been converted into a swimming pool, completely filled with water.

Suddenly, a police car showed up behind them and flashed their lights, signalling for the group to stop.

When they did stop, the police officer in the police car confronted them via his loudspeaker, asking them what the group thought they were doing and scolding them to get out of their converted vehicle, before approaching the group.

“What are you guys doing? How can you (ride you makeshift vehicle) here? Call a tow truck now! Get down!”

 

While speaking to the police officer, Isa Isarb explained that he and his friends converted a Proton Waja into a swimming pool.

The police told them that their actions were dangerous, especially if they caused an accident, and asked them where they were going, to which Isa Isard responded, “To Terengganu”, from Klang.

The group also clarified that, while the BMW towing them had a road tax, they only had a grant to the Proton Waja.

“As long as it doesn’t cause an accident,” the police officer said.

 

Netizens want action to be taken

The video then showed the police officer driving away, leaving them at the side of the highway. It is unknown whether the police officer took action against the group or if he had just let them off with a warning.

This caused many to call out the police for allegedly not taking action against the influencers for their dangerous antics.

“They didn’t get fined? (The vehicle) was not seized? Give me that police car’s number plate.”

“Why didn’t they get fined? Aren’t they in the wrong?”

“Summon them lah. What’s wrong is wrong. How can they just be let go like that?”

“Even motorcycles without brake lights would get seized. This one, with the roof cut off, they can just be told to call a tow truck.”

 

If at first you don’t succeed, try again?

In another video, it is revealed that the group didn’t proceed with their journey as the Proton Waja had been damaged and called for a tow truck to transport the Proton Waja elsewhere.

Isa Isarb then suggested his group buy another car in Terengganu and convert it into a swimming pool. While Isa Isarb said they should discard the Proton Waja somewhere, one of his friends said that they should give it away to one of their fans.

 

You can check out their videos on this incident here:

@

entry.title: KLIA Ranks 1st in the World for Quality of Service, Outperforming Over 350 Airports
entry.summary:
The Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) is ranked first out of 355 airports listed in the Global Airport Service Quality (ASQ) Performance Rankings. Based on a report by BERNAMA, the ‘ASQ Departures Passenger Satisfaction Report: KUL Benchmark Performance’ Q3 2024 analysis by the Airports Council International (ACI) stated that KLIA achieved a perfect score of […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
The Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) is ranked first out of 355 airports listed in the Global Airport Service Quality (ASQ) Performance Rankings.

Based on a report by BERNAMA, the ‘ASQ Departures Passenger Satisfaction Report: KUL Benchmark Performance’ Q3 2024 analysis by the Airports Council International (ACI) stated that KLIA achieved a perfect score of 5.00 on a scale of 1 (poor) to 5 (excellent).

KLIA’s performance also outperformed the overall satisfaction score for the Global ASQ Average, which is 4.32.

 

KLIA scored 5.00 in several categories, outperforming the Customs Panel Average of 4.88, the Asia-Pacific Average of 4.77, and the overall satisfaction score for the average airport handling more than 40 million passengers annually, which is 4.42.

It also ranked first for Customs Panel Average (first out of 20 airports), Asia-Pacific Average (first out of 100 airports), and Average of Over 40 Million Passengers (first out of 41 airports).

For overall experience, KLIA also maintained a perfect score of 5.00.

 

The survey, which was conducted between July 1 to September 12 of this year, covered responses from 352 passengers aged 16 years old and above.

Overall, 355 airports participated in the ‘ASQ Departures Main Programme’ in the third quarter of 2024.

What do you think about this? Do feel free to share your thoughts in the comment section.

 

Also read: SG Intelligence Agency Alleges That Data of 17 Million Malaysian ICs is Being Sold on Dark Web

Source: Consultant HSS
Source: The New Straits Times

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.

entry.title: M’sian Shares How KKM Raided a Korean Eatery in KL to Issue Closure Notice Right After He Ordered His Food
entry.summary:
A netizen recently shared on X about a surprise visit by the Ministry of Health (KKM) to a famous Korean eatery in a Kuala Lumpur mall. According to the post, he mentioned how he and his friends were about to dine there when KKM suddenly showed up for an inspection. “Our B40 food spot got […]

This post first appeared on WORLD OF BUZZ.
entry.content:
A netizen recently shared on X about a surprise visit by the Ministry of Health (KKM) to a famous Korean eatery in a Kuala Lumpur mall.

According to the post, he mentioned how he and his friends were about to dine there when KKM suddenly showed up for an inspection.

“Our B40 food spot got raided”

The user added that he had just arrived and placed his order when, out of nowhere, KKM slapped a closure notice right at the counter for everyone to see.

The caption of the user’s post reads,

“Latest info: Our B40 Korean food spot in Kuala Lumpur branch got raided by KKM and was immediately hit with a notice. Right after we placed our order, the guy slapped the closure notice sticker on the shop.”

Netizens started sharing their own experiences and speculations about the eatery, with many expressing that they weren’t surprised by the news.

“After I bought it, small cockroaches and insects started crawling out of the plate. I showed it to the cashier, and he swapped it for something else. While I noticed things moving around on the table, I couldn’t see where they were coming from.”

 

“It’s usually because the place is dirty, possibly to close for a week for cleaning. A mall manager I know once told me that if a customer reports seeing cockroaches near the food, they’ll inspect the place the next day. He actually found cockroaches and had to shut the shop down.”

 

“If the Ministry of Health closes the place immediately, it means the kitchen is extremely dirty, with pests running around. If it’s that filthy, it’s no surprise they’ve been fined.”

 

“Internal info: Compliance with food safety and typhoid regulations. A total of 5 outlets have been shut down.”

 

“It’s not just about cleanliness. Food contamination risks are also a concern, such as meat being stored with vegetables or fish, the presence of pests, and the use of expired or damaged ingredients. It also includes workers without proper typhoid vaccinations or food handler certificates.”

 

What are your thoughts on this? Let us know down in the comments!

 

Also read: Business is Booming for Muslim Eatery That Faced Boycott Threats After Owner Was Seen Feeding Stray Dogs
